Title: Debt, The
Author: Matthew Vaughn  Jane Goldman  Peter Straughan

Replies.Reply: Please, sit, sit. My God, it must be election season.
I came. So you're the famous author I've heard so much about?

I keep track of people Rachel.

- I'm just telling you - we don't talk to him. We don't listen to him. He isn't there. He isn't a human being. He...

He's not getting away from me.
I decide what the mission is! If I say he dies, he dies.

Nothing. Not a trace. Nothing at all.

No-one's ever going to find him again.
Only four people know what happened in this room. Us, and him. And he's not talking. No one will ever hear from him again.
Nobody needs to know what happened here.

That's the truth. But that doesn't have to be the truth we take home. The truth can be anything we want it to be. The truth is Vogel tried to escape, you struggled with him and got hurt. The truth is, seconds before he got away, Rachel got the gun and shot him. The truth is we got rid of him.... got rid of the body... got rid of every trace of the Surgeon of Birkenau.
No, you know what? We have to. We have to! This is...this isn't about us. This is about Israel.
Maybe that's a worse fate. Maybe that's...The important thing is justice... justice is seen to be done!
He's right. It makes no difference. No difference. All we have to agree is that we never talk about this. No matter what happens, we never tell anyone.
Rachel? Say it. It's an oath. Say it.

I told him to find Vogel. I told him to finish it.

Sarah's so proud of you, Rachel.
We should never forget how young they were.
...a man whose sadistic experiments left thousands disfigured or dead, who became known by a name which defiles the annals of medicine: The Surgeon of Birkenau.
Their mission had been to return him to Israel to stand trial.
But this was not what was celebrated. It was their youth itself that became a symbol. Here were the children who had faced Israel's greatest nightmare, her greatest pain...
...and in the simple act of facing the Monster, had helped to vanquish it.
Mother, I'm so very proud to be your daughter.

only journalist in Israel she won't speak to.
Rachel's daughter - SARAH - stands at a podium, reading the Dedication to a rather large audience who have come for the launch of her first book.
Rachel sits at a table with Stephan, watching her daughter.
Would you come with me sir?
West Berlin trains pass through East Berlin on this track, but don't stop.
The station's guarded at all times...
...and the stairs to the platform are sealed off.
Our train driver makes an unscheduled stop on the near track.
We're just one more parcel. Once we're in West Berlin there'll be transport to Templehof airbase and a private charter.
I want this. I want to get Vogel.

It's alright. It's alright. It's nearly over.

His mouth's taped. You want him to suffocate?
We're not animals. Just remember what we are. Remember what we're not.
What does a monster like you know about suffering?
children trying to change the colour of their eyes. You inject people with petrol. You...you replace people's hands and legs and you watch as they...

"On the evening of the 31st of December, it began to rain more heavily. So isolated had they become from the outside world that it was only when she looked out of the window that Rachel remembered it was New Year's Eve...

where he'd been travelling, that he'd been teaching... We spoke for a few minutes and then I had to go.

Before Argentina we lived in Hungary where my husband studied...

I'll tell you something. At that moment, when I was on the floor, I wasn't thinking about myself at all. I was thinking about my mother. And what she had suffered in Europe. I think that was what gave me the strength to get up again.

I think we are going to see results.
